body_html:
(1) Please review guidelines here before raising an issue
(2) Following is a definition of tf.where and comments to match with your code.

tf.where (
   condition,                                 // tf.equal(x,y) , Dimensions must be equal
   x = None,                                  // x = x "Your variable x"
   y = None,                                  // y = y "Your variable y"
   name = None                                // Name = "String"
)

(3) Please see the following code for your reference,

x = tf.Variable([2, 1], dtype = tf.float32)
y = tf.Variable([2, 3], dtype = tf.float32)
z = tf.where(tf.equal(x,y), x , y , name = "float_Equal")
print(z)

Output : -

Tensor("float_Equal_2:0", shape=(2,), dtype=float32)

(1) Please review guidelines here before raising an issue
(2) Following is a definition of tf.where and comments to match with your code.
tf.where (
   condition,                                 // tf.equal(x,y) , Dimensions must be equal

   y = None,                                  // y = y "Your variable y"
   name = None                                // Name = "String"
)

(3) Please see the following code for your reference,
x = tf.Variable([2, 1], dtype = tf.float32)
y = tf.Variable([2, 3], dtype = tf.float32)
z = tf.where(tf.equal(x,y), x , y , name = "float_Equal")
print(z)

Output : -

body:
(1) Please review guidelines [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md) before raising an issue 
(2) Following is a definition of tf.where and comments to match with your code.
 ```
tf.where (
    condition,                                 // tf.equal(x,y) , Dimensions must be equal
    x = None,                                  // x = x "Your variable x"
    y = None,                                  // y = y "Your variable y"
    name = None                                // Name = "String"
)
```
(3) Please see the following code for your reference,

```
x = tf.Variable([2, 1], dtype = tf.float32)
y = tf.Variable([2, 3], dtype = tf.float32)
z = tf.where(tf.equal(x,y), x , y , name = "float_Equal")
print(z)
```

Output : -

`Tensor("float_Equal_2:0", shape=(2,), dtype=float32)`
